snippet: More than half of humanity now lives in cities, and even more will soon. The world will have to confront how to make cities more fit for human habitation.
abstract: United Nations report finds more than half of world's population now lives in cities, as compared to 30 percent in 1950; full two-thirds of human-kind are expected to live in cities by 2050, raising new challenges for cholera, classrooms and food production..
lead_paragraph: More than half of humanity now lives in cities, and even more will soon. The world will have to confront how to make cities more fit for human habitation.

headline.main: U.N. Finds Most People Now Live in Cities
headline.print_headline: Most People in Cities, U.N. Finds
